{"step_by_step_thinking": "To determine at what stage of embryonic development initial tooth development begins, we need to analyze the information provided in the relevant documents. Document [1] states that primary teeth start to form in the development of the embryo between the sixth and eighth weeks. Document [2] also mentions that primary (baby) teeth start to form between the sixth and eighth weeks in utero. Document [9] confirms that primary dentition begins to form in-utero between 6 and 8 weeks of gestation. Based on this information, it can be concluded that initial tooth development begins at the 6th week of embryonic development.", "answer_choice": "B"}
